result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle Everett Rinde was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Scott R. Needham September 10, 2018.

Concurrent to 14CT82, 14CF100 and 14CF312.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: to 14CT82, 14CF100 and 14CF312

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
Balance of $24.12 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF496.
DNA Surcharge.

-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
-Random and regular testing.
-NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with Madison K.
-Complete MRT.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Letter of apology to Victim.

timeConds.notes:
Condition time, retroactive to August 3, 2016.
Huber granted.

chargeModifiers.descr: as a Party to a Crime

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Diess, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:   Michael Edward Nieskes DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab DF:  Kyle Everett Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 8:11. Includes 14TR1222, 14TR1221, 15CF260, 14CT82, 14CF496. Atty. Schwab updates the court.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to 14CT82 and Ct 1 , 2  in 14CF496. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of 14CT82 and Ct. 1 and 2 in 14CF496. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses 15CF260, 14TR1221 and 14TR1222. Atty.'s waive a PSI. Court waives a PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE makes a statement. Crt orders: Sentence W/H. 
18 mo.  probation to be concurrent with 14CF100 and 14CF312.
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
On 14CT82: Conditions.
247 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
90 days St. Croix County Jail STAYED.
- AODA and all follow through recommended by agent. 
- 18  mo. DL revocation
- 18  mo IID credit for admin. suspensions
- $300 plus costs
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Random and regular testing. 
- DE to have absolutely NO CONTACT  with the following named persons and/or locations, M. Koepke.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Complete MRT.
-  Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Letter of apppology to victim.
Court reserves on restitution pending hearing with commissioner. 

On 14CF496- Sentence W/H 
- 4 years probation to be concurrent 14CT82.
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge. 

Any monies remaining to be appied to outstanding fines and then applied to costs on these cases. With the balance to be paid through probation.
Filed by Atty Schwab. Def wishes to Plea. km

**AMENDED**
Includes 14CF496 and 14CT82

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. Testing every Wed. and Sat. by 5:00pm. Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each UA test with an officer of the same sex. 
- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Madison  K.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Michael E. Nieskes with student intern Ryan Moertel. DF ATTY: Donald J. Schwab DF: Kyle Everett Rinde appeared from jail. Case called at 10:10. Includes 14CF100, 14CF312,14CF496, 14CT82, 14TR1221 and 14TR1222. Atty. Schwab updates the court. Their motions are withdrawn.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. Court accepts the withdrawl. Atty. Schwab believes there are no corrections to the PSI. Sentencing arguments. DE has completed some classes in jail. DE makes statement. Crt orders: 
14CF312
- Ct. 1- 9 months county jail concurrent to 14CF312 count 2 and 14CF100 I/S. 4 years probation.
- Ct. 2- 5 years 6 months total confinement,  2 years 6 mo. Initial and 3 years ES. I/S 4 years probation.
Conditions: for counts 1 and 2. 
- Costs for both counts
- Restitution will be joint and several with Gary Parent
- AODA and all recommended treatment.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Follow all recommended programming by agent.
- DE to participate in MRT.
-  NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michael Wink, Jordan Wink, Mathew Hayes, Madison Koepke, Kenneth Bierl and Samantha Gillis.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Continue with mental health treatment.
- DE to maintain Employment

14CF100 
-  3 years 6 months total confinement. 1 year 6 months initial. 2 years ES. Cosecutive to count 2 in 14CF312.  I/S 4 years probation.
Conditions: 
- Costs
- Restitution- will be joint and several with Gary Parent. 
- AODA and all recommended treatment.
-  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times.This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Follow all recommended programming by agent.
- DE to participate in MRT.
- NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Michael Wink, Jordan Wink, Mathew Hayes, Madison Koepke, Kenneth Bierl and Samantha Gillis.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Random and regular testing. 
- Continue with mental health treatment.
- DE to maintain Employment
Bond to be forfeited for costs and restitution.

DE eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and Substance Abuse Program. If DE is revoked conditions of probation will be the conditions of ES. 
Court reserves on credit for time served. Atty. Schwab to submit calculated credit within 10 days. If not agreed upon 20 days granted for argument. Court reserve on restitution pending review in 10 days. 
DE is to be released Tues. May 26, 2015. 
DE to report to probation.  

DE may appear by phone if in treatment for the PTC for 14CF496, 14CT82, 14TR1221, 14TR1222.

   

  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 11:30 am.
